title: Does ring doorbell work without battery? - Quora

response.answer_text: Some do some don’t. I have the Ring Pro it hooks up to the old door bell wiring. There is a device that parallels the transformer at the doorbell that must be installed it guarantees the device has enough power. Don’t ask me how I don’t know. But there are things you need to know before buying. You May well have to replace your router if it doesn’t meet the requirements of the Ring. It seems Belken Routers are a problem. I had to upgrade mine to get it to work properly.

Yes, a doorbell works without batteries if the doorbell is wired and connected with an electrical source in the house. A doorbell will not ring without batteries. However, back in the old days, some old houses front doors have a string for visitors to pull, the doorbell will swing back and forth, the pendulum in the center will hit the bell to make sound to notify the house owners that someone is coming.
